Hi,

We take a similar approach, indexing the WARC files which we hold on HDFS
via a Hadoop job. We also use a command-line version of the tool for smaller
indexing tasks. We're developing these tools as an open source project, so
you're more than welcome to take a look:

https://github.com/ukwa/warc-discovery

Best wishes,
Andy Jackson



-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com on behalf of Markus.Mirsberger
Sent: Fri 4/26/2013 10:10
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] SOLR
 
  

Hi,

yes....I am indexing into Solr 4.1.

It depends how you crawl and what you want to index.
Basically all you need to do is to open the warc files and read them record
by record, extract the information you want (this all can be done with the
java library that come with Heritrix) to index and then use the SolrJ API to
add the data to your index. This all done in Java.

I think you can write your own Heritrix extension which writes directly into
the index too.
We thought about doing it this way first but we prefer to have the warc
files so I can recreate the index without crawling the websites again.

Regards,
Markus
